title: Incentives That Shape Behavior: Teams, Bonuses, and Penalties
hook: You get the AMS you pay for. If incentives reward speed and silence, you’ll get fragile fixes and hidden problems.
idea: Modern SAP AMS aligns incentives with stability, prevention, and learning — not with ticket volume or heroics.

team_level.reward_logic: Bonus grows when repeats drop quarter-over-quarter.
Penalty when regressions rise; recovery credits for clean streaks.
Credits for permanently removing top demand drivers.

individual_level.meaning: Did the person drive the issue to closure with evidence and clarity?
individual_level.note: Not about who typed the fix.

individual_level.meaning: Runbooks, KB updates, standard changes created.

apply_when: Same root cause returns within 30/60 days
Changes deployed without agreed test evidence
never_apply_when: Stopping a change due to risk

error_budget_link.concept: Failure capacity per period for critical flows.
error_budget_link.rule: When error budget is burned, risky changes pause and stability work is mandatory.
error_budget_link.effect: Shifts focus from delivery theater to reliability.

copilot_moves: Compute incentive signals automatically from incident/change data.
Generate neutral evidence packs for bonuses or penalties.
Flag incentive gaming patterns (fast close + fast reopen).
controls: Transparent formulas visible to all teams

why_this_works: Teams optimize the system, not their numbers.
metrics_that_keep_it_honest: Knowledge asset growth vs incident volume
design_question: What behavior becomes rational under our current incentives?
